maml:description.maml:para: Gets the summary of the PHP configuration on the specified IIS web site and application.

The Get-PHPConfiguration cmdlet gets the summary of the PHP configuration that is active on the site specified by "SiteName" parameter and on the application/folder specified by "VirtualPath" parameter.
Specifies a name of existing web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP configuration of that web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP configuration on a server level will be used.

Specifies a path within a web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP configuration of that configuration path within a web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP configuration for the root directory of web site will be used.
Specifies a name of existing web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP configuration of that web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP configuration on a server level will be used.

Specifies a path within a web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP configuration of that configuration path within a web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP configuration for the root directory of web site will be used.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns the summary of PHP configuration on IIS server level. That configuration will apply to all the sites on that IIS server, unless they explicitly overwrite it.

HandlerName : php-5.3.6 Version : 5.3.6 ScriptProcessor : C:\php\536\php-cgi.exe HandlerType : Local ErrorLog : C:\Windows\Temp\php-5.3.6_errors.log PHPIniFilePath : C:\php\536\php.ini InstalledExtensionsCount : 36 EnabledExtensionsCount : 0
This command returns the summary of PHP configuration that is used for the directory "/forum" on a site with name "mysite".

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the list of PHP extensions available in the currently active PHP configuration.

The Get-PHPExtension cmdlet outputs the list of all PHP extensions available in the currently active PHP configuration. The list can be filtered by extension name and by the status (enabled or disabled).
Specifies the name of the extensions to output. If the parameter is not specified then all available extensions will be listed. This parameter supports wildcards.

Specifies the status of the extension. Possible values are "enabled" and "disabled". Only the extension that match the specified status will be listed. If this parameter is not specified then all extensions will be listed.
Specifies a name of existing web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP configuration of that web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP configuration on a server level will be used.

Specifies a path within a web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP configuration of that configuration path within a web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP configuration for the root directory of web site will be used.
Specifies the name of the extensions to output. If the parameter is not specified then all available extensions will be listed. This parameter supports wildcards.

Specifies the status of the extension. Possible values are "enabled" and "disabled". Only the extension that match the specified status will be listed. If this parameter is not specified then all extensions will be listed.
Specifies a name of existing web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP configuration of that web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP configuration on a server level will be used.

Specifies a path within a web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP configuration of that configuration path within a web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP configuration for the root directory of web site will be used.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command lists all the extensions that are available for the currently active PHP configuration.
This command returns the list of extensions available in PHP configuration that is used for the directory "/forum" on a site with name "mysite".
This command lists all the enabled PHP extension that have "pdo" in their name.
Name Status ---- ------ php_pdo_firebird.dll Enabled php_pdo_mysql.dll Enabled php_pdo_oci.dll Enabled php_pdo_odbc.dll Enabled php_pdo_pgsql.dll Enabled php_pdo_sqlite.dll Enabled

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the list of configuration settings for currently active PHP configuration.

The Get-PHPSetting cmdlet gets the list of configurations settings for currently active PHP configuration on the site specified by "SiteName" parameter and on the application/folder specified by "VirtualPath" parameter.
Specifies the name of a PHP setting. If this parameter is not specified then all PHP settings will be listed. This parameter accepts wildcards.
Specifies the PHP.INI section where the setting belongs to. If this parameter is specified then only the settings from the specified section will be listed.
Specifies a name of existing web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP configuration of that web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP configuration on a server level will be used.

Specifies a path within a web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP configuration of that configuration path within a web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP configuration for the root directory of web site will be used.
Specifies the name of a PHP setting. If this parameter is not specified then all PHP settings will be listed. This parameter accepts wildcards.
Specifies the PHP.INI section where the setting belongs to. If this parameter is specified then only the settings from the specified section will be listed.
Specifies a name of existing web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP configuration of that web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP configuration on a server level will be used.

Specifies a path within a web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP configuration of that configuration path within a web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP configuration for the root directory of web site will be used.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command lists all the configuration settings for the currently active PHP configuration.
This command returns the list of configuration settings for the PHP configuration that is used for the directory "/forum" on a site with name "mysite".
This command returns the list of configuration settings that contain "error" in their names and that belong to "PHP" section.

Name Value Section ---- ----- ------- error_reporting E_ALL & ~E_DEPRECATED PHP display_errors Off PHP display_startup_errors Off PHP log_errors On PHP log_errors_max_len 1024 PHP ignore_repeated_errors Off PHP track_errors Off PHP html_errors Off PHP error_log "C:\Windows\Temp\errors.log" PHP
